page.title: 07Industry in Billingham
page.content: The agricultural division of ICI has it's headquarters in Billingham. More than half of the output of this division is in the form of fertilizers for British farmers. In Billingham the plant covers 1100 acres which makes it one of the largest in Europe and the latest figures show that it employs 7000 people. Within the site there are 10 miles of major roads, 18 miles of minor roads and 37 miles of railway lines. Over 20 000 000 gallons of water are used every day in the manufacture of fertilizers, methanol, carbon dioxide, ammonia and various catalysts which ICI produces. ICI began its links with Billingham in the 1920's and its name has been synonymous with the town for many years past and probably for many years to come.
